Create a Triage Effectiveness Plot

Source: R/plot_te.R
plot_te.Rd

This function generates a plot to visualize Triage Effectiveness (TE) metrics. It can display Theoretical Triage Effectiveness (TTE) and Observed Triage Effectiveness (OTE) for different units, with optional grouping variables and variability intervals.

plot_te(
  data,
  title = "Triage Effectiveness Plot",
  show_tte = NULL,
  show_ote = NULL,
  show_var = NULL,
  var_alpha = 0.5,
  dumbell_width = 1,
  var_width = 1.5,
  var_end_width = 1,
  var_end_height = 0.1,
  label_style = "half",
  min_x = NULL
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the following columns:

  • unit: Factor or character vector of unit names

  • tte_te: Numeric vector of Theoretical Triage Effectiveness values

  • ote_te: Numeric vector of Observed Triage Effectiveness values

  • boot_tte_var_lower: Optional. Lower variability value for TTE

  • boot_tte_var_upper: Optional. Upper variability value for TTE

  • boot_ote_var_lower: Optional. Lower variability value for OTE

  • boot_ote_var_upper: Optional. Upper variability value for OTE

title

Character string for the plot title. Default is "Triage Effectiveness Plot".

show_tte

Logical, whether to display TTE values. Default is NULL. Will show if there is TTE data.

show_ote

Logical, whether to display OTE values. Default is NULL. Will show if there is OTE data.

show_var

Logical, whether to display variability intervals. Default is null. Will show if there is variability data supplied.

var_alpha

Numeric between 0 and 1, specifying the transparency of variability interval lines. Default is 0.5.

dumbell_width

Numeric, specifying the width of the line connecting TTE and OTE points. Default is 1.

var_width

Numeric, specifying the width of the main variability interval lines. Default is 1.5.

var_end_width

Numeric, specifying the width of the variability interval end lines. Default is 1.

var_end_height

Numeric, specifying the height of variability interval end lines as offset from center. Default is 0.05.

label_style

categorical, valid inputs - "none", "small", "full" & "half". Decides the style of the label for TTE/OTE on the rights side of the graph. Default is half witch nets the label style as: "Theoretical TE"

min_x

Percentual value that is the minimum value that the plot will stretch to. Default is null which uses the min value in the data rounded to the next 10%. Useful to set if you have several plots with one that has negative values to keep the same aspect ratio.

Value

A ggplot object representing the Triage Effectiveness plot.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
data <- data.frame(
  unit = c("Unit A", "Unit B", "Unit C"),
  tte_te = c(0.6, 0.7, 0.5),
  ote_te = c(0.65, 0.75, 0.55),
  boot_tte_var_lower = c(0.55, 0.65, 0.45),
  boot_tte_var_upper = c(0.65, 0.75, 0.55),
  boot_ote_var_lower = c(0.60, 0.70, 0.50),
  boot_ote_var_upper = c(0.70, 0.80, 0.60)
)
plot_te(data, show_var = TRUE)
} # }
